sen.j: 騰勅符（とうちょくふ）とは、天皇の勅を伝えて施行するために出される太政官符。
sen.e: Tochokufu refers to a Daijokanpu (the official documents of the Daijokan, the office of the supreme political leader) to deliver and enforce the order of the Emperor.

sen.j: 「騰」は、早馬で伝えるという意味である。
sen.e: 'To (謄)' means to deliver by post horse.
To (謄)' means to deliver a message by post horse.
sen.cmt: よりわかりやすくするために、deliver の後に a message を加えました。

sen.j: また、勅旨をそのまま太政官符に書き写した（「謄」）謄勅符（とうちょくふ）も騰勅符の一部であり、しばしば混同される。
sen.e: The copied ('謄') tochokufu that the chokushi (imperial order) is transcribed to a Daijokanpu without change is also a part of the tochokufu, and they are often mixed up.

sen.j: 古くは公式令 (律令法)の解釈から、勅旨を在外諸司に伝えるために作成されたと考えられてきた。
sen.e: It was formerly considered that it was created to deliver the chokushi to the officials outside Kyoto, according to the interpretation of the Kushiki-ryo (law on state documentary forms in the Yoro Code) (Ritsuryo law).
sen.cmt: 一原文一訳文原則例外処理
sen.e: It was formerly considered that tochokufu was created to deliver the chokushi (imperial order) to the officials staying outside of Kyoto, according to the interpretation of the Kushiki-ryo (law on state documentary forms in the Yoro Code) (Ritsuryo law).
sen.cmt: わかりやすくするために、it をtochokufuにしました。Chokushiの後に（imperial order)を加えました。Officialsの後に, stayingを加えました。
sen.e: It was formerly considered that tochokufu was created to deliver the chokushi (imperial order) to the officials staying outside of Kyoto, according to the interpretation of the Kushiki-ryo (law on state documentary forms in the Yoro Code) (Ritsuryo law).

sen.j: が、近年の研究では、必要によっては詔や太政官奏など天皇から出された命令全般が対象となり、かつ在京諸司に対しても出されていたと考えられている。
sen.e: However, the recent study shows that all the orders issued by the Emperor including mikotonori (imperial decree) and Daijokanso (report to the emperor from Daijokan) were subject as needed, and that it was also issued to the officials staying in Kyoto.
